subject: Re: [junit] Re: Get AssertionFailedError when assert from another thread.

messageBody:
hmmm...there is information about that in the FAQ from
the www.junit.org website. Usually when I'm testing
that an exception is supposed to be thrown, I'll do
something like:

public void testExceptionThrown() {
try {
MyClass.methodThatThrows();
fail("Should have thrown MyClassException");
} catch (MyClassException myClassException) {
}
}

The website mentions that, and also an exception test
case, but I haven't used that yet.

-Eric

--- nsparis <nathan.paris@...> wrote:
> Let me make it clearer...The exception is thrown,
> which is what is
> suppose to happen, but instead of being printed out
> in JUnit it
> crashes JUnit. I.e. JUnit isnt automatically
> catching it and
> flagging it as an error for the test case.
>
> What do I need to change so that JUnit catches the
> exception and
> reports it as an error?
>
>
> --- In junit@y..., "nsparis" <nathan.paris@l...>
> wrote:
> > In one of my tests I start a thread that will call
> update() when it
> > is done. In the Update I check the results. If
> an
> > assert it called because something isnt correct, I
> get the
> Exception:
> >
> > junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: "Message I
> had in the assert
> > stmt."
> >
> > Is there something different I need to do when I
> am running threads
> > in my tests?
> >
> > Thanks
>
>
